studyTitle: Safety and Efficacy of the Xanomeline Transdermal Therapeutic System (TTS) in Patients with Mild to Moderate Alzheimer\’s Disease

studyProtocolVersions.officialTitle:
Safety and Efficacy of the Xanomeline
Transdermal Therapeutic System (TTS) in Patients
with Mild to Moderate Alzheimer\’s Disease
studyProtocolVersions.publicTitle:
Safety and Efficacy of the Xanomeline Transdermal
Therapeutic System (TTS) in Patients with Mild to
Moderate Alzheimer\'s Disease

studyDesigns.studyDesignDescription: The main design for the study

studyPopulations.populationDescription: Patients with Probable Mild to Moderate Alzheimer\'s Disease

studyObjectives.objectiveDescription:
To determine if there is a statistically significant relationship (overall Type 1 error
rate, alpha=0.05) between the change in both the ADAS-Cog (11) and CIBIC+
scores, and drug dose (0, 50 cm2 [54 mg], and 75 cm2 [81 mg]).

objectiveEndpoints.endpointDescription:
Alzheimer\'s Disease Assessment Scale - Cognitive Subscale, total of 11 items
[ADAS-Cog (11)] at Week 24

Video-referenced Clinician’s Interview-based Impression of Change (CIBIC+) at
Week 24

studyObjectives.objectiveDescription: To document the safety profile of the xanomeline TTS.

objectiveEndpoints.endpointDescription: Vital signs (weight, standing and supine blood pressure, heart rate)

objectiveEndpoints.endpointPurposeDescription:
The change from baseline laboratory value will be 
calculated as the difference between the baseline lab value and the endpoint value (i.e.,
the value at the specified visit) or the end of treatment observation

studyObjectives.objectiveDescription:
To assess the dose-dependent improvement in behavior. Improved scores on the
Revised Neuropsychiatric Inventory (NPI-X) will indicate improvement in these
areas.

objectiveEndpoints.endpointDescription:
Alzheimer\'s Disease Assessment Scale - Cognitive Subscale, total of 11 items
[ADAS-Cog (11)] at Weeks 8 and 16

Video-referenced Clinician\’s Interview-based Impression of Change (CIBIC+) at
Weeks 8 and 16
Mean Revised Neuropsychiatric Inventory (NPI-X) from Week 4 to Week 24

studyDesigns.studyDesignRationale: The discontinuation rate associated with this oral dosing regimen was 58.6% in previous studies, and alternative clinical strategies have been sought to improve tolerance for the compound. To that end, development of a Transdermal Therapeutic System (TTS) has been initiated.

studyElements.studyElementDescription: Xanomeline TTS (adhesive patches) 50 cm2, 54 mg + 25 cm2, 27 mg

transitionStartRule.transitionRuleDescription: Administration of first dose (from patches supplied at Visit 4)
Administration of first dose (from patches supplied at Visit 12)

studyRationale: The discontinuation rate associated with this oral dosing regimen was 58.6% in previous studies, and alternative clinical strategies have been sought to improve tolerance for the compound. To that end, development of a Transdermal Therapeutic System (TTS) has been initiated.
